channel.description: Recent content in data structures & algorithms on Aidan Fogarty

item.title: The Queue Data Structure
item.description: A Queue is a linear structure which follows the principle of First In First Out (FIFO). In simple terms, a queue is just a data structure that implements a “first come, first serve” solution. Similiar to how if you join a queue in a coffee shop, you must wait until all customers ahead of you, have ordered their coffee. The Queue data structure has two main operations: enqueue adds an item to the back of the queue.

item.title: The Stack Data Structure
item.description: I have decided to refresh my brain, with all the data structures and algorithms and what better way to do it, than to write about it? So, the first topic I plan to walk through is the “stack” data structure. So what is the “stack” data structure? A stack is a linear data structure that follows the principle of Last In First Out (LIFO). So what does this mean?
